fact1.randomFact: Styrofoam never biodegrades! It basically lasts forever! Styrofoam products fill up 25 to 30 percent of landfill space around the world.

fact2.randomFact: In the past 50 years, humans have consumed more resources than in all previous history.

fact3.randomFact: Municipal solid waste generated in 2017 increased to 4.51 pounds per person per day.

fact4.randomFact: Paper and paperboard products made up the largest percentage of all the materials in landfills, at 25 percent of total generation.

fact5.randomFact: Once landfills are full, sometimes they build on top of them. Things like golf courses!

fact6.randomFact: Some states send their trash to other states.

fact7.randomFact: Recycling aluminum takes 95% less energy than making aluminum from raw materials.

fact8.randomFact: The United States throws away enough glass bottles and jars to fill a 1,350 square foot building every week.

fact9.randomFact: Enough plastic bottles are thrown away each year to circle the earth four times.

fact10.randomFact: In a lifetime the average American will throw away 600 times the amount of his or her adult weight in garbage.

fact11.randomFact: Middle Point Landfill, where Nashville sends its trash, accepts an average of 3,700 tons of waste a day.

fact12.randomFact: With less than 5% of the world’s population, the U.S. was responsible for about one third of the world’s total material consumption in 1970-1995.
